verses.verse: And afterward<WH310> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> went in,<WH935> and told<WH559> <WH413> Pharaoh,<WH6547> Thus<WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> Let<WH853> my people<WH5971> go,<WH7971> that they may hold a feast<WH2287> unto me in the wilderness.<WH4057>

And Pharaoh<WH6547> said,<WH559> Who<WH4310> is the LORD,<WH3068> that<WH834> I should obey<WH8085> his voice<WH6963> to let<WH853> Israel<WH3478> go?<WH7971> I know<WH3045> not<WH3808> <WH853> the LORD,<WH3068> neither<WH1571> <WH3808> will I let<WH853> Israel<WH3478> go.<WH7971>

And they said,<WH559> The God<WH430> of the Hebrews<WH5680> hath met<WH7122> with<WH5921> us: let us go,<WH1980> we pray thee,<WH4994> three<WH7969> days'<WH3117> journey<WH1870> into the desert,<WH4057> and sacrifice<WH2076> unto the LORD<WH3068> our God;<WH430> lest<WH6435> he fall upon<WH6293> us with pestilence,<WH1698> or<WH176> with the sword.<WH2719>

And the king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> said<WH559> unto<WH413> them, Wherefore<WH4100> do ye, Moses<WH4872> and Aaron,<WH175> let<WH6544> <WH853> the people<WH5971> from their works?<WH4480> <WH4639> get<WH1980> you unto your burdens.<WH5450>
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said,<WH559> Behold,<WH2005> the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> now<WH6258> are many,<WH7227> and ye make them rest<WH7673> <WH853> from their burdens.<WH4480> <WH5450>
And Pharaoh<WH6547> commanded<WH6680> the same<WH1931> day<WH3117> <WH853> the taskmasters<WH5065> of the people,<WH5971> and their officers,<WH7860> saying,<WH559>

Ye shall no<WH3808> more<WH3254> give<WH5414> the people<WH5971> straw<WH8401> to make<WH3835> brick,<WH3843> as heretofore:<WH8543> <WH8032> let them<WH1992> go<WH1980> and gather<WH7197> straw<WH8401> for themselves.

And the tale<WH4971> of the bricks,<WH3843> which<WH834> they<WH1992> did make<WH6213> heretofore,<WH8543> <WH8032> ye shall lay<WH7760> upon<WH5921> them; ye shall not<WH3808> diminish<WH1639> aught thereof:<WH4480> for<WH3588> they<WH1992> be idle;<WH7503> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> they<WH1992> cry,<WH6817> saying,<WH559> Let us go<WH1980> and sacrifice<WH2076> to our God.<WH430>
Let there more work be laid<WH3513> <WH5656> upon<WH5921> the men,<WH376> that they may labor<WH6213> therein; and let them not<WH408> regard<WH8159> vain<WH8267> words.<WH1697>

And the taskmasters<WH5065> of the people<WH5971> went out,<WH3318> and their officers,<WH7860> and they spoke<WH559> to<WH413> the people,<WH5971> saying,<WH559> Thus<WH3541> saith<WH559> Pharaoh,<WH6547> I will not<WH369> give<WH5414> you straw.<WH8401>
Go <WH1980> ye,<WH859> get<WH3947> you straw<WH8401> where<WH4480> <WH834> ye can find<WH4672> it: yet<WH3588> not<WH369> aught<WH1697> of your work<WH4480> <WH5656> shall be diminished.<WH1639>
So the people<WH5971> were scattered abroad<WH6327> throughout all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> to gather<WH7197> stubble<WH7179> instead of straw.<WH8401>
And the taskmasters<WH5065> hasted<WH213> them, saying,<WH559> Fulfill<WH3615> your works,<WH4639> your daily<WH3117> <WH3117> tasks,<WH1697> as when<WH834> there was<WH1961> straw.<WH8401>

And the officers<WH7860> of the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> which<WH834> Pharaoh's<WH6547> taskmasters<WH5065> had set<WH7760> over<WH5921> them, were beaten,<WH5221> and demanded,<WH559> Wherefore<WH4069> have ye not<WH3808> fulfilled<WH3615> your task<WH2706> in making brick<WH3835> both<WH1571> yesterday<WH8543> and<WH1571> today,<WH3117> as heretofore?<WH8543> <WH8032>

Then the officers<WH7860> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came<WH935> and cried<WH6817> unto<WH413> Pharaoh,<WH6547> saying,<WH559> Wherefore<WH4100> dealest<WH6213> thou thus<WH3541> with thy servants?<WH5650>

There is no<WH369> straw<WH8401> given<WH5414> unto thy servants,<WH5650> and they say<WH559> to us, Make<WH6213> brick:<WH3843> and, behold,<WH2009> thy servants<WH5650> are beaten;<WH5221> but the fault<WH2398> is in thine own people.<WH5971>
But he said,<WH559> Ye<WH859> are idle,<WH7503> ye are idle:<WH7503> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> ye<WH859> say,<WH559> Let us go<WH1980> and do sacrifice<WH2076> to the LORD.<WH3068>
Go <WH1980> therefore now,<WH6258> and work;<WH5647> for there shall no<WH3808> straw<WH8401> be given<WH5414> you, yet shall ye deliver<WH5414> the tale<WH8506> of bricks.<WH3843>

And the officers<WH7860> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did see<WH7200> that they were in evil<WH7451> case, after it was said,<WH559> Ye shall not<WH3808> minish<WH1639> aught from your bricks<WH4480> <WH3843> of your daily<WH3117> <WH3117> task.<WH1697>
And they met<WH6293> <WH853> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron,<WH175> who stood<WH5324> in the way,<WH7125> as they came forth<WH3318> from<WH4480> <WH854> Pharaoh: <WH6547>

And they said<WH559> unto<WH413> them, The LORD<WH3068> look<WH7200> upon<WH5921> you, and judge;<WH8199> because<WH834> ye have made<WH853> our savor<WH7381> to be abhorred<WH887> in the eyes<WH5869> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> and in the eyes<WH5869> of his servants,<WH5650> to put<WH5414> a sword<WH2719> in their hand<WH3027> to slay<WH2026> us.

And Moses<WH4872> returned<WH7725> unto<WH413> the LORD,<WH3068> and said,<WH559> Lord,<WH136> wherefore<WH4100> hast thou so evil entreated<WH7489> this<WH2088> people?<WH5971> why<WH4100> is it<WH2088> that thou hast sent<WH7971> me?

For since<WH4480> <WH227> I came<WH935> to<WH413> Pharaoh<WH6547> to speak<WH1696> in thy name,<WH8034> he hath done evil<WH7489> to this<WH2088> people;<WH5971> neither<WH3808> hast thou delivered<WH5337> <WH853> thy people<WH5971> at all.<WH5337>
